channel.title: A Tutorial for Creating Backdoors with "CovertUtils" Package
channel.description:
Hello guys!
I 'm in the proud position to announce you that the `covertutils` Documentation is _mostly_ **finished**:
http://covertutils.readthedocs.io/
There will be constant improvements but the base is ready to give it a read!
This Documentation contains a [**TUTORIAL**](http://covertutils.readthedocs.io/en/latest/assembling_backdoor.html) of course!
Create a Backdoor with remote module loading support! Feel like _H.D. Moore_ but writing in `Python` (goddammit). In the article/docpage we create a **Reverse TCP Backdoor**, because starting _slow and steady_ is the key to world domination.
And do not lose the chance to win a **free beer** if you ever get in Greece (where I usually live), or in any Con you happen to bump on me _(it won't be easy)_. Details in the Tutorial (somewhere)...

item.title: A Tutorial for Creating Backdoors with "CovertUtils" Package
item.dc:creator: operatorequals
item.description:
I am firewall’d by the corporal on IRC. Back in 8 hours…

Read full topic

item.title: A Tutorial for Creating Backdoors with "CovertUtils" Package
item.dc:creator: _py
item.description:
Yeah we’ve talked with @operatorequals on IRC. My field is more binary-related as you probably know so I’m pretty sure I don’t stand much of a chance.

I’ve also noticed @operatorequals at the ECSC quals’ scoreboard this year for our country’s national team. Check out the alias “0sec” @operatorequals, it should ring a bell.

Read full topic
item.source: A Tutorial for Creating Backdoors with "CovertUtils" Package

item.title: A Tutorial for Creating Backdoors with "CovertUtils" Package
item.dc:creator: operatorequals
item.description:
I think we talked before with @_py. If I remember correctly he studies really close to my home (like 10 bus stops).

He gotta solve the challenge first though, or his beer is on him…

Read full topic
